Key Arguments: The Bill allows the government to define misinformation and disinformation, potentially making it the arbiter of truth.
The legislation conflicts with Article 19 of the UN Declaration of Human Rights, which protects freedom of opinion and expression.
High penalties for non-compliance could lead to excessive censorship by online service providers.
The Bill poses a threat to freedom of speech and could stifle healthy and respectful debate.
Notable Quotes: I am very concerned that our Australian government wants to be the arbiter of truth, rather than allowing freedom of speech for all Australian citizens.

The Bill conflicts with Article 19 of the UN Declaration of Human Rights, where 'everyone has the right to freedom of opinion and expression.....and to seek, receive and impart ideas through any media'.
